Intercepted agent messages encrypted with RSA using two blum integers. Can you exploit this to decrypt the secret contents? Ciphertext: 1162210677151770212469501926439432504921572794790457042904159603083512745314672867573104906653724869648254093479917249627690774088582396589461287920906870

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8527246835543934979200029943038669954582443013557843212697245518679894940927071152103352918813616018650271937312636827663648362311744737706472817743188269, e=3480296655659766181566661764099182194368093032679682317337880210483144684940199452894478791313529069362133836818746005632415110444772587305132212403225815
The lower 104 bits of p are: 37188434963195031182050661289851429431


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{vhw3xgeo}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1162210677151770212469501926439432504921572794790457042904159603083512745314672867573104906653724869648254093479917249627690774088582396589461287920906870
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8527246835543934979200029943038669954582443013557843212697245518679894940927071152103352918813616018650271937312636827663648362311744737706472817743188269, e=3480296655659766181566661764099182194368093032679682317337880210483144684940199452894478791313529069362133836818746005632415110444772587305132212403225815
The lower 104 bits of p are: 37188434963195031182050661289851429431

extra_info: p=114296276599875713747563737793647162150627657902785947366300839613813496816183, q=74606514658354212243115606893356386495880980271352750959114283643223058662843, Ï†(n)=8527246835543934979200029943038669954582443013557843212697245518679894940926882249312094688887625339305584933763990319025474223613419322583215781187709244
